item.title: As judges face more threats, only the Supreme Court gets new security funds
item.description: There was a spike in threats against the judiciary in the early months of 2025, Marshals Service data shows.

item.title: After a week of reprimands, some in Congress are having second thoughts
item.description: Censures were historically rare rebukes against lawmakers. But members of the House are increasingly using them in ways their peers say are political.
